feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Table maintenance alternatives in S/4HANA on premise
entry.content:
Hi,

We are working on defining best practice guidelines for creating maintenance objects in S/4HANA on promise. Depending on complexity, there seem to be a few options:

  • Using a simple Table Maintenance View from GUI with a Fiori Launchpad tile .
  • Using the Fiori app “Custom Business Objects”, which generates a BOPF object in the background.
  • Creating a ‘Maintenance Object’ from Eclipse, which generates a RAP-based solution.

Since SAP provides the Custom Business Objects app, it could be a valid option, but RAP is the strategic direction.

I would appreciate recommendations or best practices on which approach to choose for both small/simple and more complex maintenance/configuration tables. No step-by-step instructions are needed; I am primarily looking for guidance on the preferred approach.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Building RAP model with 2 tables (header and items) and having Fiori preview with Single LUW
entry.content:
I have database model having 2 Z-tables where object has header record and its items. I would like have Fiori preview app to manage both these tables so that their item lines can be added within same LUW.  

The tables and CDS views I have managed to define so, that they have dependency to each other using joins and composite and parent-child relations.

So far I have managed to generate RAP model out of my Z-tables. But it results to SAP Fiori preview, where maintenance happens on one line containing item records having repeated header data. Understand I could use annotations to get items shown on separate screen, but I understand I could not get this to work on single LUW, meaning I first create Header record (draft) and then could add items (drafts) and then save everything on same LUW, so not that header should be saved separately first before can add items to it.

I have seen blogs and videos of RAP model having annotations on other related tables with Fiori app preview for display only. But not blog with CRUD features. Or well, found one by spyvee domain but I think it was incomplete guide and I never got it working. When googling "sap btp rap two tables", Google AI lists needed actions, but I consider its guidance is also not complete. I have heard being demonstrated by SAP (not yet seen myself), that ABAP AI could do what I am looking for.

So with this question I am asking if there is (which I haven't found yet) a blog for multiple table maintenance on RAP  or someone could provide complete guidance here.

I understand there is a RAP concept (with blogs) if tables are a customizing tables (consider similar as SM30 in old SAP ERP), but in my case tables are not customizing data.

entry.title: Duplicates in draft on test tenant - public cloud
entry.content:
Hi community,

I have created a managed with draft application in the public cloud. ( list report )
I tested it on the dev tenant and then transported it to the test tenant.
The testing on the dev tenant were without errors.
On the test tenant I'm encoutering the following error:
All items that i create, get the same draft uuid. Meaning once i press go I see no data as I get a duplicate error message or if I continue with the create message, i get an page error as again, my table contains duplicates.

Duplicate error:
Failed to get contexts for /sap/opu/odata4/sap/z_billing/srvd/sap/z_billing/0001/Billinginfo with start index 0 and length 30 - Error: Duplicate key predicate: (ParentId=fa163e0b-7372-1fe0-a0fd-9f1480095443,IsActiveEntity=false)

If I look into my odata response with the dev tools, I can see all my created items, still in draft mode, with a non unique draft uuid.

I'm thinking about trying out late numbering to fix the issue, but I don't understand why the issue happens in the first place.
It works fine on the dev system.

a)Any suggestions ?

Further cloud questions related to this issue.
b)How can i delete data from my draft table from the test tenant ?
  Do i need to call an api service that can delete data or build a data managing app ?
c)If I'm not mistaken, it is not possible to look into the databases on the test tenant, correct ?

Kind regards
JT

entry.title: SAP to Non-SAP Using ODATA Service
entry.content:
Hi All,
I am new to OData and have a requirement for SAP to Non-SAP integration. The goal is to create data in SAP, such as Vendor and Purchase Requisition, using OData services.

I have gone through different posts and blogs, but I am finding different solutions, which is a bit confusing. Could anyone please guide me on the actual process to achieve this? A clear explanation would also be helpful for beginners like me.

Your support and guidance will be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your time and assistance.

OData ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model API, @ABAP @ABAP_abap @odata

entry.title: refresh table custom page fiori elements
entry.content:
Hello,

I built a RAP fiori elements list report with a custom page as object page:

when the save button in clicked, the method save_modified in the backend is correctly called and everything works well. The problem is that I would like to make a Get call after the save because I need to refresh the UI. 

How to do this ?

Many thanks

entry.title: Odata metadata error : Model 'ZGW_XXX_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator
entry.content:
We are experiencing a failure in metadata calls from the application in our environment. The issue is impacting the functionality of OData services and causing delays in data retrieval.

Steps Taken:

  1. Cleared Gateway (GW) cache,
  2. Checked the Service maint configuration.
  3. All network and connection are good.

error: Model 'ZGW_SMS_MDL_0001_BE' contains errors. Contact Adminstrator

error id:  /IWFND/MED039

url: /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZGW_XXX_SRV/$metadata

We request assistance in analyzing the root cause of the metadata call failure. Please advise on:

  • Any known issues or patches related to metadata failures.
  • Recommended steps to debug or resolve the issue.
  • Whether additional Gateway or backend configurations need to be reviewed.

Note: we are facing this issue as intermittent.

entry.title: Real Estate Contract management: How to maintain Notes
entry.content:
Problem Statement - Want to create or update Notes for real estate contract for each node like posting term, conditions etc.

Business Scenario:  We want to build a custom utility to create or update the Memo or Notes section of real estate contract using ABAP on S4 HANA Public cloud

Expected Solution - Solution to create or edit memo/notes long text fields on real estate contract

Please let us know if there is a way in SAP CLM Cloud version where we can create or edit memo/notes.

SAP Real Estate Management SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP Sourcing and SAP Contract Lifecycle Management

entry.title: How to pass long error messages (> 50 Char) as free text in Reported Structure for Managed service?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m Facing an issue here in passing a message free text ( >50 or >100 char) to display my RAP application in Reported. I am Using it through the %msg =  new_message_with_text() method via the Reported parameter %msg. the message gets cut off after 50 characters while Displaying.

I tried to Use another method  new_message() as well, Spliting Long message in V1, V2, V3 ,V4 but getting Duplicates messages here. 

new_message(

* id = ''

* number = '00'

* severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error

* v1 = 'Error'

* v2 = | for combination of Company Code: |

* && | ,Gl Account|

* v3 = |:| && ls_cl_error-gl_account

* v4 = || && | ,Joint Venture Equity Group:|

* && ls_cl_error-costcenter

 

Please suggest me how to display Long free texts.

 Thank you

@SAPExpert @RaP @saptech

entry.title: Extending C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni app Monitor Purchase order items has Payment terms description
entry.content:
My requirement is to have payment terms and payment term description in the item table of Monitor Purchase order Items app.

For this i have used extend view on consumption view C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni and brought in payment terms by having an association on I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 payment terms. Now i want to display payment terms description from T052u-TEXT1 table.

This value is present in the CDS I_PAYMENTTERMS and I am trying to join using associations but getting the error 

'Association .paymentterms cannot be used locally '.

I suppose this error occurs as Payment terms are not present in the base view that i am extending and when i refer to I_PurchaseorderAPI01 for the payment terms to use in the association.

 

How can i modify the below CDS to bring the payment terms description into the app.

 

extend view C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni with ZXXX

 

//I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 has the required fields Incoterms and payment terms

association [1..1] to I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 as _PurchaseorderheadAPI01

on $projection.purchaseorder = _PurchaseorderheadAPI01.PurchaseOrder

 

{

 

 

//Adding the payment term details

@EndUserText.label: 'Payment Terms'

_PurchaseorderheadAPI01.PaymentTerms,

 

 

}

I have tried creating a new CDS with purchase order number , payment terms and payment term description to refer to in the association and have got the same error.

Any help is highly appreciated, thanks.

entry.title: controller extension flexible programming model load fragment return undefined
entry.content:
Hello,

in the controller extension the following code is not working:

        openDialog: function (text, formVisible, fnAction) {
            return new Promise(
                function (resolve, reject) {
                    this.base.getExtensionAPI()

                            controller: this
                        })
                        .then(function (approveDialog) {
                            console.log(approveDialog);
 
 approveDialog is undefined even if the http call for the fragment is ok.
Any Hint ?
 
Thank you
 
Filippo

entry.title: SAP RAP ListReport - ValueHelp not displayed in parameted dialog for action
entry.content:
Hello Everybody,

In SAP RAP (S4Hana on premise 2022) I have defined an Action with parameter:

static action notPlanedRev parameter ZD_BEFR_FUNC_LOC result [1] $self;

Hier is the defiinition of Entity:

@EndUserText.label: 'Parameter für Aktion notPlanedRev'
define root abstract entity zd_befr_func_loc

{
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'ZC_BEFR_FUNC_LOC', element: 'FuncnlLocPrimaryLabelName'  }}]
  FunctionalLocation : text40;
  RevTxt             : text40;
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'I_PlantStdVH', element: 'Plant'  }}]
  Plant              : werks_d;
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'zc_befr_work_center_vh', element: 'WorkCenter'  },
                                      additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'Plant', element: 'Plant', usage: #FILTER_AND_RESULT }]}]
  WorkCenter         : arbpl;
  duration           : int2;
}

I have exposed the Entities for SH in mein Service (Binding OData V2 - UI)

@EndUserText.label: 'PM GBR Betriebsfreigabe'
define service Zui_pm_gbr_befr {
  expose zc_befr_revision;
  expose zc_befr_func_loc;
  expose ZC_BEFR_NOTIF_ASSIGNED;
  expose ZC_BEFR_NOTIF_ASSIGNED_RELEASE;
  expose ZC_BEFR_NOTIF_ASSIGNED_IN_OPER;
  expose ZR_BEFR_NOTIF_for_rev;
  expose zc_befr_work_center_vh;
  expose zi_befr_release_type_vh;
  expose zc_befr_oper_release;
  expose ZC_BEFR_OPER_IN_OPER;
  expose zc_befr_order;
  expose ZC_BEFR_ORDER_IN_OPER;
  expose I_WorkCenterStdVH;
  expose I_PlantStdVH;
}

and the Preview in Eclipse are the ValueHelps displayed:

But in deploed app they are not shown:

 

How can it be solved?

Regards,

Boguslaw

entry.title: Hide/display fields depending of active/draft status of an entity using Metadata extension
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a very simple requirement for a RAP application. I have two fields, one must be displayed only for the draft (inactive) version and the other one displayed only for the active version.

In the metadata extension i was able to implement this behavior for the first field using this syntax (hidden for active version, thus displayed only in draft mode)

@ui.hidden: #(IsActiveEntity)

But i could not make it work of the second field which must be displayed only in active version (hidden if draft)
I tried different variants of this syntax but nothing works
@ui.hidden:  NOT #(IsActiveEntity) 

Do you have any idea of implementation ?

Thank you

entry.title: Summary rows and other calculated rows in RAP Transactional App (List Report)
entry.content:
Hi experts!

I have a requirement to build an Excel-Sheet like Fiori-App. A Column with for an Article-ID and Columns  (12, for each month one) to enter quantites for the article. So far, no problem. Here comes the problem:  A summary row must calculate the quantities of all articles for each month. And another row must display quantites calculated via a logic. A no brainer for ALV but how to do this with RAP? I could created another analytical app just to display calculations (no option - too complex to implement and apply). Is there any solution to this simple requirement?

Thanks, Sebastian

entry.title: Extend nested standard CDS-Views
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to dive deeper into the topic of view extensions of standard CDS views. I am familiar with the basic concept and the implementation, and everything is understandable for simple or flat CDS views.

However, there are hardly any standard CDS views that have only one level, but rather multiple ones. The question that arises for me is whether it is always necessary to extend all levels in order to access a field on the "top" level. Or what is the best practice in this case (for example: extend all views? Build a custom view on the interface view and join / associate the desired table/view again? etc.) 

For the sake of comprehension, here a concrete example:

The table VBAK was extended by a custom field, via append. I now want to include the respective field in the CDS view I_SalesOrder. The view I_SalesOrder has three hierarchy levels: I_SalesOrder -> I_SalesDocument -> I_SalesDocumentBasic. The latter selects the table VBAK.

Is it now the correct way to extend all three CDS views in order to be able to access the field in I_SalesOrder? 

Thanks in advance for the help.

Best regards,
Lukas

entry.title: Service Binding: Error during compilation.
entry.content:
Hi All,

On creation of  Service Binding  in Eclipse ADT - I Checked the underlying Views and Behavior Definition. It is not showing any Problem. 

Error during compilation - See next line for details. Error in entity 'ZS4T1_C_KUNDE(CDS)': Behavior definition for 'ZS4T1_C_KUNDE' has syntax errors.

Behavior Definition - As follows

managed implementation in class zbp_s4t1_r_kunden unique;

strict ( 2 );

 

define behavior for ZS4T1_R_KUNDEN alias customers

persistent table zs4t1_kunde

lock master

authorization master ( instance )

//etag master <field_name>

early numbering

{

create( authorization : global );

update;

delete;

 

field ( readonly ) Kunnr;

association _Orders { create; }

 

mapping for zs4t1_kunde

{

Kunnr = kunnr;

Name = name;

Vorname = vorname;

Firma = firma;

Str = str;

Stadt = stadt;

Land = land;

Pstl = pstl;

Sperre = sperre;

Adatum = adatum;

Fax = fax;

Telefon = telefon;

Email = email;

Url = url;

Sprache = sprache;

Bname = bname;

Passwort = passwort;

MemoTxt = memo_txt;

CurrencyCode = currency_code;

ZzumsatzZec = zzumsatz_zec;

ZzbcountZec = zzbcount_zec;

createdBy = created_by;

createdAt = created_at;

lastchangedBy = last_changed_by;

lastchangedAt = last_changed_at;

changedAt = changed_at;

}

}

 

define behavior for ZS4T1_R_PORDERS alias Orders

persistent table zs4t1_puroders

lock dependent by _kunde

authorization dependent by _kunde

//etag master <field_name>

{

update;

delete;

field ( readonly ) Kunnr, Orderid;

association _kunde;

mapping for zs4t1_puroders

{

Kunnr = kunnr;

Orderid = orderid;

Bdatum = bdatum;

Bsumme = bsumme;

CurrencyCode = currency_code;

Rabatt = rabatt;

Bstatus = bstatus;

Info = info;

createdBy = created_by;

createdAt = created_at;

LastChangedBy = last_changed_by;

LastChangedAt = last_changed_at;

changedAt = changed_at;

}

}

 

Regards

Shobhan

entry.title: Clarification of basic RAP pattern
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have a (probably) basic question about a recommended pattern in ABAP RAP model.

Context: we are developing a custom application with on-stack extensibility on S/4HANA Public Cloud. We have a custom entity ServiceMilestone, where we record the execution of a milestone for a service, that now needs to be billed. On this entity, we have a custom action CreateBillingRequest.

In the implementation of the CreateBillingRequest, we try to do the following:

1. Read the ServiceMilestone with EML based on the corresponding keys passed in the input parameter of CreateBillingRequest in a lt_servicemilestone local variable.

2. Create with EML a new entity for I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP, using data from the lt_servicemilestone, assigning RESULT to a local lt_result, FAILED to a local lt_failed, REPORTED to a local lt_reported and MAPPED to a local lt_mapped.

3. lt_failed, lt_reported, lt_mapped are all initial after the EML creation, and the lt_result contains the CID and the fields of the newly created I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP. There is no ID generated at this moment yet for the I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP, as it uses late numbering (key field BillingDocumentRequest is still empty).

So far so good it seems. If we do nothing else and just return from CreateBillingRequest, the LUW is committed successfully and we can see the newly created BDR in S/4.

But this is not our full need. We want to associate the new I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP into our entity ServiceMilestone. We created an association [0..1] in ServiceMilestone to I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP as BRD.

Our thinking here is (still in the call to CreateBillingRequest after steps 1, 2, 3): 

4. We have to somehow read the newly created entity with EML based on the data we got from the create (that we have in lt_result).

5. We have to add this information in the MAPPED output structure of the CreateBillingRequest, where we see that we have the ServiceMilestone field.

6. The RAP framework will commit the LUW, generate the document number for the I_BILLINGDOCUMENTREQUESTTP, save the association in our ServiceMilestone-BRD.

Is this the correct way to go or we are totally off? This should be a pretty basic pattern where a new entity with late numbering is created based on released interfaces and is then associated in our custom entity where we call the custom action.

If our way of thinking is correct, it would be great to point out how to implement correctly points 4 and 5.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Display List report as Result From RAP Application After Post Action
entry.content:
Hello Everyone.

I need Assistance on RAP result Display.

I am Posting Multiple Documents with One action 'Post' in One GO. Let say I have 10 entries in list and I am trying to generate document number for all of them.

In the same BDEF method after Document number generation , Result-%parm is getting updated for All entries with Document number and other Fileds respectively. 

I want to display this result-%parm as my output(As List) for the Action. but I am getting nothing as output and getting re-routing again to List Page. "not displaying  Result-%parm".

Please assist me here me here how to display result .

On Action 'POST' Cardinality is [1] Abstract entity.

*This Abstract entity has Document no. and all other fields.

This is A RAP service only. NO Fiori, UI or BTP involvement is here.

Please suggest how we can achieve list Output.

 

Thanks,

Abhishek Aggarwal

 

@sapcommunity @saptech @RaP

entry.title: Making Fields Mandatory in "Managing Purchasing Info Record" App (Private Cloud Edition)
entry.content: As per Document # 3497433 - Making Fields Mandatory in "Managing Purchasing Info Record" App is not possible in S4 Hana Public cloud edition. However would like to check if that is an option available for Private Could Edition (FPS03) and the steps to achieve this. Basically the requirement is to make two fields (available from and available to) as mandatory in the Manage Purchasing Info Record (App ID: F1982) app. This should also be work/reflected for any backend or mass upload tool for PIR creation.
